fields.headline: BBC 'begged' for another series of Playing the Field
fields.bodyText: The BBC "begged" for another series of the Kay Mellor-scripted drama Playing the Field and wanted to transform it into a half-hour long soap opera. "The BBC asked us to turn Playing the Field into a soap - it was begging us," said Andrew Zein, commercial director of Tiger Aspect Productions. The company decided the next series, due to air in the autumn, would be the last. It will mark the end of one of the BBC's most acclaimed long-running programmes. "Some programmes - like Ally McBeal or The Bill - are designed to be endless shows and Playing the Field was also quite open-ended," said Tiger Aspect head of drama Greg Brenman. "But this is a positive thing - we wanted to end with a bang and move on to new projects." Relevant stories: Feb 1: Whistle blown on Playing the Field
